articles.title: Webb Telescope Uncovers a Mysterious Carbon Treasure Trove Around Young Star - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Using the James Webb Space Telescope, scientists have discovered a rich variety of carbon molecules in a protoplanetary disk around a low-mass star, suggesting a unique type of planet-forming environment that could lead to the creation of carbon-poor planets.…
articles.content: This is an artist’s impression of a young star surrounded by a disk of gas and dust. An international team of astronomers has used NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope to study the disk around a young a… [+6524 chars]
